title: Very long start from shortcut/desktop icon on Flatpak, Ubuntu 24.10
content:
Hello,

Since I've updated my Ubuntu from 24.04 LTS to 24.10 I see very annoying issue regarding to latest Firefox (131.0.3) installed via flatpak.

The issue occurs while I tried to start firefox via flatpak icon (desktop or program menu). When I take an action to start firefox it takes 30 seconds to few minutes sometimes to take start.

What is interesting: when I start browser from the terminal (flatpak run org.mozilla.firefox) - it works without any problem and starts immediately.

I've also tried solutions from this thread https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1442927 - no success.

Before update all works well. Also I'm using thunderbird (on flatpak too) and it starts ok.

title: Desktop: Fullscreen autohides too quick
content:
Sometimes when I am closing tabs in sequence in full-screen mode, mainly from either the left or right side, the browser will auto-hide after X'ing each tab, which is pretty annoying. Other times if I simply click the lower half of the tab, the browser will auto-hide to full-screen mode. If my cursor goes over some of the white space (address bar, or the areas in between the tabs, or the area to the right of the open tabs assuming it isn't a full bar) it will auto-hide. I noticed I can trigger this behavior 100% simply by clicking anywhere in the tab bar (X or not) and the tab bar will attempt to auto-hide to full-screen mode.

I don't think it used to be this way so my question is: Is there a way I can change the settings to make the mouse cursor location the sole determining factor (clicking) in when the auto-hide feature activates, and if I can introduce a lag time of X seconds after the mouse leaves the top bar?
creator: gelekeb764

title: Refresh icon and +sign to add tab missing with new update
content:
What the hell were you thinking with this latest update? You seriously had the nerve to remove basic, essential features like the Refresh button and the + sign for adding a new tab? Are you kidding me? These are core functionalities that make browsing smooth and convenient, and now they're just gone?

How can you possibly justify this? Did anyone over there stop to think about how frustrating this is for loyal users? It’s absurd to think that a browser as well-established as Firefox would pull such a ridiculous move. A refresh button—seriously? One of the most frequently used features in any browser, and you thought it was a good idea to just take it away? What’s next, are you going to remove the back button too?

The audacity to push an update that cripples usability is unbelievable. This isn’t innovation; it’s downright stupidity. A browser is supposed to help users navigate the web efficiently, not make us jump through hoops just to perform basic tasks! How out of touch can you be to mess this up so badly?

Get your act together and fix this mess. Stop making changes for the sake of change, and start listening to your users!
creator: joseph2bolt

title: Blocco totale del PC con Windows 10 all'avvio di Mozilla Firefox
content: Buongiorno. title: Session cookie can be restored with ctrl +shift +t
content:
If I search for what a session cookie is the common answer will be something like "It's a temporary cookie that's erased from your device once you close your web browser".

If I: 1. Open Firefox. 2. Navigate to website A. 3. Login 4. Close the browser(All windows) without loging out from the website. 5. Open Firefox. 6. Navigate to website A.

If the website has marked it's session cookie as a "session cookie" I will be logged out when I visit website A again. I can't retrieve my previous session, although It's alive on the server. The browser has seemingly, as it should, deleted my cookie since it was a session cookie.

However(!), If i repeat the steps above, but after step 5 hit ctrl+shift+t, the browser remembers my session cookie and I'm back in. Although Firefox was supposed to forget my session cookie.

title: Jazyk nabídek.
content: Nabídky na otevření nového okna, nebo třeba nabídka aplikace se mi otevírají v kombinaci angličtiny a češtiny. Najedu myší vpravo na ikonu, objeví se česky: Otevře nabídku aplikace, a když kliknu, jsou všechny řádky anglicky. A když kliknu na ty, které se dál otevírají, tedy např. Bookmarks nebo More tools, jejich podnabídka se otevře česky. Když kliknu na odkaz v textu pravou myší, jsou řádky v angličtině od Open Link In New Tab až po "Send link..", a pak je česky psané Vyhledat "xxxx" pomocí Google. Pak následuje anglické "Inspect..." Všude, kde jsem to našel, mám nastavený jazyk "Čeština. Nechápu. Mám ještě jeden komp s Mozzillou synchronizovaný s tímhle, a ten jede v češtině na 100%. Tak mi zkuste poradit, prosím na odpověď na mail lomihnat@seznam.cz Děkuji. Jiří Kejkrt

title: Stop/hide Firefox/Thunderbird update availability constant nags
content:
Please explain in simple terms (I am not an IT wizz) how I can stop the continual popups in Firefox 128 and Thunderbird 78 on a Windows 11 OS saying “Update Available” with a Download button very easily activated by mistake.

Each time I click Dismiss, a new popup appears either immediately or very soon. The popup blocks a significant area of the screen and will not move.

I already have Update Settings on “Check for updates but let you choose to install them”. There is no option to “Do not check for updates” on these versions of Firefox and Thunderbird. I already have Windows 11 Notification Settings on “Do not disturb” and all Firefox notifications to Off. 

I have found the Mozilla Support article “Customising Firefox using Group Policy” at  https://mzl.la/3bLnw2J but I do not understand it and the device I am using is not part of a group installation setup.

There is a Step by Step guide “How to stop Firefox update notifications” on Youtube at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nD-oXxrCCRs . This is clear to follow if I pause it frequently to absorb each step carefully. Is this safe for me to try given that I am very inexperienced in using the command line and accessing registry etc?

The Thunderbird popups have only recently started up and I would value advice on how to stop these safely too. I need this version of Thunderbird at present for particular reasons related to gmail so it is important I do not accidentally activate a download on that.
